critique: The document is an executive order extending the abolishment date of the National Emergency Council. It invokes the Emergency Relief Appropriation Acts of 1935 and 1937. Given the context of the New Deal era, this suggests a moderate level of government intervention in the economy. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. The ideological tilt is slightly liberal due to the New Deal context.
